item.title: Sample query to demonstrate influence of collation in Sql Server
item.description: Lately I had the pleasure to investigate collations and here is a sample query that demonstrates how a collation impacts the behaviour of a query: WITH [Words] AS ( SELECT N'Een' AS [word] UNION ALL SELECT N'Eèn' UNION ALL SELECT N'EEN' ) SELECT [word] FROM [Words] WHERE [word] --COLLATE Latin1_General_CS_AS -- returns Een --COLLATE Latin1_General_CI_AI -- returns Een, Eèn and EEN --COLLATE LAtin1_General_CI_AS -- returns Een and EEN COLLATE Latin1_General_CS_AI -- returns Een and Eèn = N'Een';
